DataElement.preferredName: Carious Dentin Tooth 30 Treatment Near Dental Pulp Involvement Caries Removal Next Decision Type
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the type of subsequent decision (the process of making a selective intellectual judgment when presented with several complex alternatives consisting of several variables, and usually defining a course of action or an idea) for removal of decayed tooth near pulp (a richly vascularized and innervated connective tissue of mesodermal origin contained in the central cavity of a tooth and delimited by the dentin) in the treament of tooth decay that has invaded the dentin for tooth number 30 (the first, permanent six-year molar of the lower right arch as defined by the Universal tooth numbering system).

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Carious Dentin Tooth 30 Treatment Near Dental Pulp Involvement Caries Removal
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to removal of decayed tooth near pulp (a richly vascularized and innervated connective tissue of mesodermal origin contained in the central cavity of a tooth and delimited by the dentin) in the treament of tooth decay that has invaded the dentin for tooth number 30 (the first, permanent six-year molar of the lower right arch as defined by the Universal tooth numbering system).

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Tooth decay that has invaded the dentin, the porous, yellow-hued material between the enamel and pulp of the tooth.:The first, permanent six-year molar of the lower right arch as defined by the Universal tooth numbering system.:An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process.

Concepts.definition: Tooth decay that has invaded the dentin, creating dentin that is partially demineralized and containing mineral crystals in the tubules.
The first, permanent, six-year molar of the lower right arch as defined by the Universal tooth numbering system.
An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process.

Property.preferredName: Near Dental Pulp Involvement Caries Removal

It has formative, nutritive, sensory, and protective functions.:To have a connection by participation or association or use; sharing in an activity or process.:Any process by which decayed tooth material is removed from the tooth.

Concepts.definition: Not far distant in time or space or degree or circumstances.

A richly vascularized and innervated connective tissue of mesodermal origin contained in the central cavity of a tooth and delimited by the dentin. It has formative, nutritive, sensory, and protective functions.
To have a connection by participation or association or use; sharing in an activity or process.
Any process by which decayed tooth material is removed from the tooth.
